title: Politico Reporter Unloaded a 'Dangerous' Commentary About Christianity on MSNBC
text: This segment was low-hanging fruit, but it‚Äôs always a good reminder to know what your enemy is thinking and their end game, often televised on MSNBC and CNN. MSNBC is by far the worst of the two, and ex-NBC News reporter Heidi Przybyla, now with Politico, demonstrated that Thursday night with her screed against Christianity. Of course, it was framed under the guise of Christian nationalism. Still, the commentary was very much grounded in mainstream concepts about where rights come from, as Thomas Jefferson is the person who wrote about what Przybyla found unsettling (via [Mediaite](https://www.mediaite.com/opinion/msnbc-guest-panics-over-christians-believing-rights-come-from-god-instead-of-earthly-authority/)): Here‚Äî Wade Miller (@WadeMiller_USMC) [@MSNBC]helpfully makes it clear their disdain for Christians in America. She says that if you believe that your rights come from God, you aren‚Äôt a Christian, you are a Christian nationalist. Somehow they seem to not mention that our own founding documents make this‚Ä¶ [pic.twitter.com/WTLMqcqTzg] [February 23, 2024] After being asked how members of Congress were reacting to Speaker Mike Johnson‚Äôs (R-LA) leadership, which was characterized as an ‚Äúinfusion of Christian nationalism into the body politic of the House,‚Äù Przybyla proceeded to butcher her interpretation of the distinction between Christians and Christian nationalists. After warning that Christian nationalists ‚Äúhave a lot of power in Trump‚Äôs circle,‚Äù she insisted that ‚Äúthe one thing that unites all of them, because there‚Äôs many different groups orbiting Trump, but the thing that unites them as Christian nationalists ‚Äî not Christians, by the way, because Christian nationalist is very different ‚Äî is that they believe that our rights as Americans, as all human beings, don‚Äôt come from any earthly authority.
